review_blob: From a can. Grapefruit aroma with a touch of wheat. Cloudy orange colour with a small head. Grapefruit flavour with some notes of hefeweizen. Medium bodied. Sweet finish.
Bottle. Faint grain aroma. Pours dark golden with a good frothy white head. Light grainy flavour with some metallic notes. Watery thin texture. A touch of bitterness in the finish.

650ml bottle. Sweet caramel aroma. Pours a slightly cloudy bronze with very small head. Some hoppy bitterness with notes of grapefruit and lime with balancing malt undertones. Medium body. Sharp bitter finish. Good beer.
500ml can. Grain/straw aroma. Classic golden pilsner appearance with small white head. Malty grain flavour with some bitter citrus notes. Medium body and a crisp bitter finish. Good pilsner.
Bottle. Sweet bread and caramel aroma. Pours cloudy bronze with large frothy head. Sweet caramel flavour with some balancing citrus hops. Medium body. Balance finish.
Bottle. Sweet cherry aroma. Pours cherry red with a medium sized pink head. Rich cherry flavour with just a touch of sourness. Medium body. Short sweet finish.

355ml bottle. Strong grapefruit and lemon aroma. Pours a cloudy orange with small white head and lots of sediment. Strong citrus hop flavour - grapefruit, lemon and orange. Medium body. Sharp bitter finish. Very good.
650ml bottle. Sweet caramel aroma. Pours copper in colour with a small head and decent lacing. Grapefuit and lime citrus flavour with some caramel notes. Medium body. Long bitter finish.
650ml bottle. Milky coffee aroma. Classic dark stout appearance with frothy brown head. Roasted coffee and dark chocolate flavour. Medium bodied. Sweet malty finish.

Bottle. Yeast and fruit (banana) aroma. Pours a very light cloudy yellow with a small head that disappears quickly. Flavour is yeast, cloves, pepper and some light citrus notes (orange). Watery texture. Mild bitter finish.
Bottle. Sweet cherry aroma. Pours a cloudy red with a slightly red frothy head. Mild cherry flavour with a faint touch of sourness. Tonic water texture. Short cherry finish.

750ml bottle. Spicey hop aroma. Pours cloudy light brown with a creamy small head. Spicey hops, pepper, cloves, pine with some citrus bitterness. Full bodied with a long bitter finish and a touch of warm alcohol.
Bottle. Sour cherry aroma. Pours reddish/brown with a light brown head. Sour tonic water flavour with notes of lemon and raspberries. Wine like texture with a mild sour finish.

beer_brewer_name: Turning Point Brewery/Stanley Park Brewing (Labatt - ABInBev)
review_blob: 500ml can. Grapefruit and pineapple aroma. Pour cloudy and golden with a big frothy white head. Bitter hop taste with notes of tropical fruits and pine. Medium bodied with a dry bitter finish.

Bottle. Very sweet coffee aroma. Pours a very dark brown/red with moderate sized head. Flavour is very sweet coffee with notes of cloves and cinnamon. Slick texture and a long sweet finish. Just a but too sweet.
500ml can. Mild grain aroma. Light golden in colour with a moderate frothy head. Flavour is grain with some very faint malt notes. Thin watery body. Nothing very much in the finish at all.

500ml bottle. Sweet malty aroma. Pours dark golden in colour with a small head. Very sweet and malty flavour with toffee/caramel notes. Maybe too sweet. Watery texture with more sweetness in the finish.

Bottle. Aroma is brown sugar with a hint of sourness. Pours a dark amber colour with small head. Moderate carbonation. Flavour is tart with notes of apple with some nicely balanced sweetness. Smooth bodied. Sweetness dominates the sour in the finish.

Bottle. Sharp sour and acidic aroma. Pours with a cloudy golden colour and creamy white head. Very sour and acidic flavour with a champagne like feel. Medium body and a sharp sour mineral water-like finish. Very good beer and wonderful bottle design.
Bottle. Fresh hay/straw aroma. Typical golden lager appearance with a medium white head. Flavour is pine and biscuits. Fairly dry with a short bitter finish. Unremarkable lager.

500 ml bottle. Clean straw-like aroma. Classic golden pilsner appearance with a good sized frothy white head. Crisp bitter flavour with notes of hay and some metallic feel. Thin to medium body. Bitter finish. Nothing special but drinkable.

beer_brewer_name: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
review_blob: Bottle. Dark chocolate and roasted coffee aroma. Pours black with a small brown head. Dark chocolate and coffee flavours. Creamy texture. Nicely balanced finish with a touch of bitterness. Good stout.

From a bottle. Mild blackcurrant aroma. Pours dark red with a frothy red head. Blackcurrant flavour with balancing lambic sourness and notes of champagne. Light bodied with a lingering sweetness in the finish. Very drinkable.

Bottle. Fresh hoppy aroma with hints of toffee. Pours a dark and cloudy orange with an off white head tinged with brown spots. Flavour is mainly citrus hoppiness with notes of toffee and vanilla. Creamy texture and a mild bitter finish. Good and interesting IPA.
Sweet raspberry aroma. Pours dark red with a red tinged head. Pleasant raspberry flavour with some faint sour notes. Medium bodied with a sweet finish.

Sweet chocolate and vanilla aroma. Dark black in colour with a good sized yellowish head. Sweet chocolate flavour with notes of vanilla and lightly roasted coffee. Full bodied with a long and sweet finish. Enjoyable.

650ml bottle. Sweet toffee aroma. Pours amber with a frothy off-white head and lots of carbonation. Mild hoppy flavour with notes of biscuit and citrus. Some underlying malts. Thin to medium body. Mild bitter finish.
From a can. Sweet and floral aroma - somewhat like cherries. Light golden in colour with a frothy white head. Sharp bitter flavour with orange, lemon and apricot notes. Long bitter finish. Good IPA.
650ml bottle. Mild citrus aroma. Pours copper in colour with a medium frothy head. Mild citrus bitter flavour with caramel and nutty notes. Medium body and a long bitter finish. Fairly good.

Bottle. Rich fruity aroma - cherries and nutmeg. Pours a very dark brown with a very small off yellowish head. Rich christmas pudding flavour with some woody/nutty notes. Medium bodied and a long sweet finish. Pretty good.

Aroma is similar to a medium roast coffee with a bit of vanilla. Pours dark black with very fine off white head. Roasted coffee flavour with notes of dark chocolate and nuts. Medium bodied. Long coffee finish.
beer_name: Back Forty Trade Day Cuban Coffee Stout

review_blob: UPDATED: MAR 6, 2016
From a can. Sweet blueberry aroma. Pours a cloudy yellow with very small white head. Mild blueberry flavour with a touch of bitterness. Medium body. Sweet finish.
Bottle. Sweet chocolate and peanut butter aroma. Classic dark porter appearance. Dark chocolate, roasted coffee and peanuts. Medium to full bodied. Long malty finish.

Bottle. Sweet vanilla and cinnamon aroma. Dark black stout appearance with a small brownish head. Vanilla, cinnamon, espresso coffee are present - quite sweet. Rich and full bodied with some warming alcohol sensations. Spicey notes in the finish. Enjoyable.
Bottle. Strong smoked aroma. Pours cloudy and dark yellow with a small head and good lacing. Smoked ham flavour with some bitter orange/citrus notes. Full bodied. Lingering smokey finish.

From a can. Light grassy aroma. Golden in colour with a large and frothy white head. Typical lager flavour - some bitterness with biscuit and metallic notes. Medium body. Mild bitter finish. Unremarkable.

Bottle. Roasted coffee, chocolate and fruit aroma. Pours dark black with a small brown head. Medium carbonation. Fruit - cherry and strawberries, roasted coffee, cocoa beans - very complex. Full bodied with an oily texture. Well balanced finish with some sweet maltiness and a touch of bitterness. Excellent.

341ml bottle. Roasted coffee and dark chocolate aroma. Dark brown in appearance with a medium sized head. Roasted coffee, dark chocolate with some hoppy undertones. The malts definitely outweigh the hops. Full bodied with some bitterness in the finish. Not bad.
Bottle. Spicey orange aroma. Cloudy yellow colour with small white head. Orange flavour with notes of pepper and cloves. Medium body and a bitter finish.

Large bottle. Sharp grapefruit aroma. Pours cloudy yellow/orange with large frothy head. Sharp citrus with grapefruit and lime flavours balanced with some malty toffee notes. Medium to full bodied. Long bitter citrus finish. Good IPA.
Bottle. Fruity and floral aroma. Pours opaque dark yellow with a large frothy head. Hoppy and spicy flavour with notes of cloves, corriander and nutmeg. Medium bodied. Moderate bitter finish.

Bottle. Fruity aroma - mango and strawberry. Pours cloudy dark yellow with frothy white head. Bitter citrus flavour with notes of grapefruit and pepper. Medium bodied and sharp bitter finish. Interesting beer.

473ml can. Light toffee aroma. Pours copper in colour with a decent frothy white head. Miimal carbonation. Flavours are toffee and biscuits with a low to medium level of hoppiness. Medium bodied. Mild bitter finish. OK.

From a bottle. Roasted coffee and dark chocolate aroma. Pours jet black in colour with a small rusty brown head. Taste is like an espresso with notes of dark chocolate and nuts. Thick and medicinal in texture with some warming alcohol feeling. Nicely balanced finish. Good stout.

Bottle. Spice, nutmeg and pumpkin aroma. Dark brown in colour with creamy off white head. Spice, cloves and nutmeg with subtle pumpkin flavours and some hops. Full bodied and a slightly bitter finish. Good brew.
beer_name: Anderson Valley Fall Hornin Pumpkin Ale

review_blob: 355ml bottle. Strong blueberry and maple aroma with a hint of coffee as well. Porter like in appearance - black with a small brownish head. Very sweet and malty with blueberry, maple, coffee and brown sugar flavours. Full bodied with a syrupy texture. Sweet malty finish. Not bad if you dont mind the sweetness.
From a can. Fresh banana aroma. Cloudy dark orange colour with a small white head. Banana, cloves and spice flavours. Thin to medium body with a sweet finish. Decent brew.

From a can. Strong spice, nutmeg and christmas pudding aroma. Opaque dark brown colour with a yellowish head. Christmas pudding and brandy flavours with lots of dark fruit and warming alcohol. Full bodied with a very sweet malty finish.
650ml bottle. Moderate lemon - citrus aroma. Pours a cloudy dark brown/orange with frothy head. Toffee, grapefruit and cloves are present in the flavour. Creamy texture and a strong bitter finish.
beer_name: Arrowhead Im So Freaking Hoppy! IPA
